meanings.sent1: The cold wind seemed to benumb my fingers.
meanings.sent2: The dentist used a numbing gel to benumb my gums before the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to benumb his assistant's hand without her realizing.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous lecture began to benumb the students' minds.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the graveyard seemed to benumb all who entered.

meanings.definition: To deprive of physical or emotional feeling.
meanings.sent1: The tragic news seemed to benumb her heart with sorrow.
meanings.sent2: The extreme exhaustion benumbed his body after the long hike.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie seemed to benumb the audience with shock.
meanings.sent4: The overwhelming grief threatened to benumb her ability to feel anything at all.
meanings.sent5: The icy water quickly began to benumb his exposed skin.
